name: TradingMachine
tagline: TradingMachine is a mini-trading system simulation written in Java 8, whose components (market data and order simulators, FIX acceptor and initiator, back-end for filled orders) interact by queues and topics.
body:
TradingMachine is a mini-trading system simulation made up of the following components:

* Market data feed: randomly builds ask/ bid prices and ask/ bid sizes for a given symbol and then publishes them onto a queue every X seconds.
* Orders feed: randomly builds market, limit and stop orders and then publishes them onto a queue every X seconds.
* FIX acceptor: listens on the market data and orders queues and provides order execution by a matching engine. It can deal with market, limit and stop orders. Market orders are always filled unless they're FOK, specifically, a market price will always be available from the market data while the quantity might not match the bid/ ask size. Limit and stop orders will be filled only if their limit/ stop price and quantity match the market data. Limit orders are subject to FOK too.
* FIX initiator: acts as an OMS, routing orders to the acceptor. It listens on the orders queue and forwards them to the FIX acceptor. If the acceptor replies with filled orders, then it publishes them on a topic.
* Filled orders back-end store: subscribing to the filled orders topic, it stores them to MongoDB and MySql back-ends. The scripts to set up the MySQL database, tables and stored procedure, are provided in TradingServices/src/main/resources.
* Trade Monitor UI: Java Swing program showing all filled orders from the MongoDB repository along with live orders from the FilleOrdersTopic.

It's built on Ubuntu 15.04 and Eclipse Mars, using the following technologies: Java 8, QuickFIX/J (FIX 5.0), Maven, ActiveMQ, MongoDB and MySql.

## High-level architecture
![TradingMachine Architecture](https://github.com/NicolaNardino/TradingMachine/wiki/Images/TradingMachineArchitecture.jpg)

## Trade Monitor UI
![Trade Monitor UI]
(https://github.com/NicolaNardino/TradingMachine/wiki/Images/TradeMonitorUI.jpg)

## How-to run the various components
* ServicesRunner starts the market data, orders feed and filled orders subscriber. Furthermore, it starts a statistics service which builds various statistics on aggregated data.
* TradingMachineServer starts the FIX acceptor.
* TradingMachineOrderRouter starts the OMS and FIX initiator.
* TradeMonitorUI starts the monitor UI.

## Upcoming developments
* Stop_limit orders matching algorithm.
* JNDI-based topic and queues. In fact, for now I'm using the custom (very good) ActiveMQ implementation.
